events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on March 30th at an intersection. They submitted the initial claim detailing the accident and damages to the vehicle.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the keywords related to vehicle collision and damages described in the report.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer with the claim process and provide updates regarding the investigation and settlement.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed to the customer that the process had officially started. Customer was appreciative of the prompt response.
Requested accident report, vehicle repair estimate, and photos of the damaged car from the customer to proceed with claim investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including a police report, photos of the damage, and a detailed repair estimate from a certified auto shop.
The claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and contacted the repair shop to verify damage estimates and timelines.
The investigation confirmed the accident details and repair costs. No discrepancies were found, and the claim was ready for settlement proposal.
A settlement offer was sent to the customer covering the full repair costs minus the deductible, along with instructions on how to accept the terms.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and thanked the claims team for their clear communication and support throughout the process.
Following acceptance from the customer, the claim was officially approved in the system and prepared for payment issuance.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued to the customer's designated bank account to cover vehicle repairs.
The claim was formally closed in the system after confirming receipt of payment and customer satisfaction with the resolution.
All claim files and documents were archived securely in compliance with company policy for future reference if needed.
